triples.name: Natural language processing
triples.relevance: The core field of study that the paper benchmarks models in to assess fairness and intersectional biases.

triples.name: Machine learning
triples.relevance: The foundational technique used in the NLP models evaluated for fairness and bias.

triples.name: Fairness (machine learning)
triples.relevance: The core fairness evaluation framework that the paper applies to assess NLP model performance.

triples.name: Algorithmic bias
triples.relevance: The systematic bias problems in algorithms that the paper aims to benchmark and understand.

triples.name: Gender bias
triples.relevance: A specific demographic dimension of bias that the paper evaluates in NLP models.

triples.name: Racism
triples.relevance: The paper uses race as one of the demographic dimensions for assessing intersectional bias in NLP models.

triples.name: Intersectionality
triples.relevance: The novel framework the paper proposes for understanding how multiple demographic biases interact in NLP models.

triples.name: Language model
triples.relevance: The computational models that the paper benchmarks for fairness across demographic dimensions.
